Key Arguments: The bill is unnecessary and could lead to control of expression similar to totalitarian governments.
It is inconsistent with the fundamental right to freedom of speech.
The bill gives too much power to unelected officials who could silence speech they disagree with.
Historical examples show that dissenting voices have been labeled as misinformation or disinformation.
The bill could lead to a lack of genuine debate and the silencing of controversial opinions.
The penalties for tech companies could stifle debate due to fear of repercussions.
The bill could result in only the official government position being safely presented.
Notable Quotes: This Bill is unnecessary & if passed has the ability to be used to control all expressions in the various media areas in the same way that totalitarian Governments do.
The proposed Bill is inconsistent with the fundamental right to freedoms of speech.
This whole Bill reeks of a desire to control the information that is in the various media outlets so that only the official government position on anything can be safely presented.
